oai_dc:dc.dc:title: J.W. Howard Petition

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Petitions; Religious fundamentalism; Creation; Biology; Evolution; Sunday schools; Methodist churches; Correspondence
Peay, Austin, 1876-1927; Darwinism in America; Greeneville (Tenn.); Rhea County (Tenn.); Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A one page, typed petition to Governor Austin Peay in support of Tennessee's anti-evolution law. The letter is on the letterhead of the Sunday school teacher, J.W. Howard.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Howard, J.W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The petition was sent to Governor Austin Peay by the Asbury Bible Class of the Methodist Episcopal Church of Greeneville, Tennessee. The letter is in support of Governor Peay's stance on the anti-evolution legislation. It states that "we deplore that the; people are drawn into an abstract theory, which is not established by any science."
